message_1:
Consider the following substitution cipher where each letter of the alphabet is replaced by a unique number from 1 to 26:
```
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
zcbvakxgfthpriqonmlsuedwy
```
Encrypt the message "mathematics is fun" using this substitution cipher.
message_2:
Using the given substitution cipher, we can encrypt the message "mathematics is fun" as follows:

m -> z
a -> c
t -> p
h -> r
e -> i
m -> z
a -> c
t -> p
i -> q
c -> b
s -> y

i -> q
s -> y

f -> g
u -> d
n -> w

So, the encrypted message is "zcprzcpqby qy gdw".
